title: Fatal Dagsboro crash under investigation
content: CLOSE       Barbara J. Atkins of Georgetown was killed in a May 30, 2018, crash involving a bus and a van on Route 113, Delaware State Police said. Ryan Marshall, rmarshall@delmarvanow.com          Delaware State Police is investigating a fatal crash on Dagsboro Road that occurred June 1, 2018. (Photo: Delaware State Police submitted image)      Delaware State Police are investigating a fatal Friday afternoon crash that closed Dagsboro Road for more than four hours.    Police said a 59-year-old Frankford woman was driving a 2010 Chevrolet Cobalt north along Dagsoro Road at about 2 p.m. when, for unknown reasons, she crossed the center line into opposing traffic.     A 60-year-old Maryland man traveling south in a 2017 Volvo 12 wheel roll off container hauler tried to swerve to the right, according to the police, but was unable to avoid the Cobalt. The right front areas of both vehicles collided on the shoulder.    The Cobalt started rotating in a clockwise direction and came to a stop in an unplanted field on the west side of the road, police said, while the Volvo continued south before leaving the road and stopping in that same field.     MORE:  In wild chase that plowed into house, woman sentenced to four years    Police said the woman driving the Cobalt, who was not properly secured, was pronounced dead at the scene, and the Volvo driver, who was properly secured, was treated for minor injuries at a local hospital and released. Drugs and alcohol are not believed to be factors in the crash for either driver.    Police closed Dagsboro road for roughly four-and-a-half hours while the crash was investigated and cleared. The investigation remains ongoing and anyone with information about the collision is asked to contact Cpl. J. Burns of the Troop 7 Collision Reconstruction Unit at 302-644-5020.    Information can also be provided by calling Delaware Crime Stoppers at 1-800-TIP-3333 or online at  http://www.delaware.crimestoppersweb.com .
